item.title: Drawer carcass dumped on pavement, 18th January
item.description:
Appeared in the last day or so. Needs removal. And if possible a hard kick in the backside for the anti-social person who felt it OK to leave their rubbish for someone else to deal with! ðŸ˜¡

item.title: Pedestrian gate still locked at 12:30pm, 18th January
item.description:
Whoever is responsible for unlocking the gates at South Hill Wood left this one locked! Lots of confused dog walkers around. As it happens I have a key myself so I unlocked it, but this needs to be recorded so a word can be had...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 foot nativity fiquers and nativity shed fly tipped, 18th January
item.description:
Just watched the family from 10 Oslo square remove the nativity figures and nativity shed from their garden, carry them across the road to the green garden site opposite their ramp, and dump their huge garden Christmas decorations next to a small brick wall. This family have been reported so many times before because they fly tip here on a weekly and often a daily basis. When are southwark council going to do something about this problematic family who have little respect for their neighbours or green space areas?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black prince road potholes, 18th January
item.description:
The entire stretch of black prince road to Albert embankment, including the pavements, need repairs and a resurface. There are raised manholes, large potholes, broken and raised pavement and kerb stones all along it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Black Prince Road, Lambeth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
